bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 26, 1915

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to proceed to South Carolina to confer with State Health officials.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 26, 1915
div1.opener:
JKC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WMT
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 26, 1915.
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
In connection with your investigations of impounded
waters, you are hereby directed to proceed, on or about
February 1, 1915, to Columbia, S.C., and other places with-
in that State, in order to confer with the State Health
Officer, and afterwards proceed to make an investigation
in regard to the malaria conditions caused by the impounding
of waters by the Parr Shoals Hydro-Electric Company.

A report on the results of this investigation will be
made to the Bureau.

While on this detail, your status will be that of
special temporary duty, and on completion of the duty en-
joined you will rejoin your station at Baltimore, Md.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon-General. e
s
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
Assistant Secretary.
RB
